name: Ideal Gas Law
explanation: The ideal gas law relates pressure (P), volume (V), temperature (T), and amount of gas. PV = nRT (n = moles) or PV = mRT (m = mass, R = specific gas constant). This is fundamental to thermodynamics, used in analyzing engines, compressors, and gas systems. Assumes gases behave ideally (no intermolecular forces, point particles).

examples.problem: A gas at 100 kPa and 300K occupies 0.5 m³. If temperature increases to 400K at constant pressure, what is new volume?
steps: PV = nRT, so V/T = constant (constant P and n)

examples.problem: Air (R = 287 J/kg⋅K) at 200 kPa, 0.1 m³, 300K. What is the mass?
